message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.MM. 

The paper focuses on improving the performance of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) on visual recognition tasks, specifically by making them more invariant to spatial transformations of images. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the proposed method involves training CNNs with randomly transformed feature maps, which involves learning a more robust mapping from input images to transform-invariant representations. This involves optimization and machine learning techniques, which fall under the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also evaluates the proposed method on image retrieval tasks, which falls under the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with image recognition tasks, which falls under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
